title: Perry County, AL Jury List Request

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Perry County, AL Jury List Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act I hereby request the following records:
The following materials regarding the compilation and composition of the state’s master jury list:

All current policies and procedures regarding how the current master jury list was compiled and how often master jury lists are reviewed and updated. Please name all source lists (driver’s license records, voter registration lists, etc) that were utilized in creating the current master jury list.

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding the composition of the current master jury list. Please include the total number of individuals on the current master jury list and all relevant demographic data, including but not limited to the race, age and gender of individuals that comprise the current master jury list.

In the event that there are any fees for obtaining or copying these records, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Should the fees exceed $100, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees as I am requesting the information on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how master jury lists are created. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.
If possible, please provide the requested documents electronically. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records. Further, if you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact me with information concerning when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption that justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within the timeframe required by the statute.

title: State and outside compensation records for VA Tech professor

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: State and outside compensation records for VA Tech professor
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Custodian,

I seek records regarding the compensation of Dr. Broderick Turner, assistant professor of marketing at Virginia Tech. Specifically I seek records generated from January 1, 2020 to the present date that provide the following:

-Amounts and terms of Dr. Turner’s annual compensation as a university employee (salary, stipends, etc)

-Amounts and terms of any outside compensation Dr. Turner has disclosed to Virginia Tech pursuant to university policies on outside compensation.

-Any disclosures Dr. Turner has provided to Virginia Tech related to work with Axon Enterprise Inc., in his capacity as a member of Axon’s Ethics and Equity Advisory Council (EEAC), and/or in any other capacity, including amounts of compensation, terms of compensation, and the scope of tasks performed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Scott Gordon.

title: IA investigation number IAD2016-0223 Boston Police

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: IA investigation number IAD2016-0223 Boston Police
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting  documents  for  a 2016 Interanal Affairs investigation number IAD2016-0223 regarding Boston Police Officer Lieutenant David C Murphy, badge number 9375.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Annemarie Grant

title: Brian Muoio - Signal

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brian Muoio - Signal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding Officer Brian Muoio #8381, I am requesting from his City-owned Android device:

1. For every conversation in the officer’s Signal app, including archived and deleted conversations, please provide:
1a. The title, avatar, description, and retention period set for the chat.
1b. A listing of all members in the chat.
1c. All messages, images, and files sent and received in the chat, sufficient to discern sender’s name and avatar, time received, and message content, as well as events including but not limited to entering and leaving chat, changing retention time, etc.

2. The list of all contacts in the officer’s Signal app. This can be found by clicking the “New Message” icon.

3. The name, avatar, and username set for the officer themself. This can be found by clicking the profile icon.

If copying these messages by hand is burdensome, I understand that SPD owns software tools that can be used to extract these records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Police :: P206936-120224
communications.communication:
At this time, the Seattle Police Department’s Legal Unit is operating under a backlog of over 4,500 open requests. We deeply appreciate your understanding and patience as we work diligently to respond to all pending requests. 
 
 
Dear Rose Terse: 
 
Thank you for using the Seattle Police Public Records Request Center.
 
Your request was received on December 02, 2024and the reference number is P206936-120224. 
 
If the City's representative entered your request into the system and you didn't specifically register:

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Elixir Labs Contract for Oregon Provider Management and Payment Platform
communications.communication:
Good morning Toni,

We received an email request via the platform Muckrock for a public records request. The following was the body of the email:

“Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:
Contract awarded to Elixir Labs from the Provider Management Platform RFP, #S-58100-00007532.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.”

DELC’s public record request form can be found here: Department of Early Learning and Care : Contact Us : About Us : State of Oregon<https://www.oregon.gov/delc/about-us/pages/contact-us.aspx> .
The are also separate instructions for alternate submission forms. DELC’s public records request system allows us to accurately track and communicate regarding requests and the back and forth regarding the request. I look forward to hearing from you or seeing your submission soon.

In accordance with ORS 192.324(4)(a), the public body may establish fees reasonably calculated to reimburse the public body for the public body’s actual cost of making public records available, including costs for summarizing, compiling, or tailoring the public records, either in organization or media, to meet the request.

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Best wishes,
[A picture containing graphics, cartoon  Description automatically generated]
Madison Buck (She/Her)​
Department of Early Learning and Care​
Public Records and Communication Specialist
DELC.PRRequest@DELC.oregon.gov<mailto:DELC.PRRequest@DELC.oregon.gov>

The Oregon Department of Early Learning and Care (DELC) fosters coordinated, culturally appropriate, and family-centered services that recognize and respect the strengths of children, families and early learning and care professionals. Our vision is that all children, families, early care and education professionals, and communities are supported and empowered to thrive.

Scope is regardless if the services were provided or not. These records are between any member of the VMI Faculty or staff including, without limitation, the VMI Procurement Office, Superintendent’s Office, Human Resources Office, Inspector General/Title IX office, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Office and/or any others involved in the identification, selection, coordination, acquisition and delivery of trainings, workshop(s), presentations and/or instruction regardless if they are purchased and/or provided at no cost. This includes and/or any coordination and/or procurements and/or sessions completed or ongoing regardless if agreements were reached or not and/or if training, workshops, presentations, instruction and/or other offerings were provided, not provided or are planned. The scope of this request includes, without limitation any and all speaker bios and proposed or provided presentations, trainings, workshop structures, topics and/or programs of instruction. A the minimum these should include, without limitation, BigSpeak Inc.,Campus Outreach Services Inc.,Kara Dixon Vuic,Raven Solomon Enterprises LLC,Rainbow Bridge,NewPoint Strategies,Modern Military Association,Passageways, Inc.,Visions,Woods Rogers PLC. For the purpose of this FOIA “Records” are defined as any public record subject to disclosure under the Va. FOIA including any writing or recording, paper record, electronic file, audio, video recording, or any other format. This term shall mean all relevant data and information in the Custodian’s possession defined in [a] Requester’s General Subject of Inquiry and [b] Specific Subjects of Inquiry including but not limited to letters, notes, drafts, legal instruments, proposals, marketing materials from vendors, contracts, telephone transcripts, email correspondence, drawings and tables. Includes, without limitation, any and all forms of memorialized information, whether written, graphic, computerized, or stored electronically or on tape.  This definition specifically includes, but is not limited to, drafts, originals, copies, handwritten notes or comments, letters, correspondence, e-mails, records of discussions, memoranda, telegrams, telephone logs and records, teletypes, appointment books, meeting agenda or minutes, reports, briefings, presentations, studies, analyses, communications with government bodies, interoffice and intra-office communications with any party whatsoever, computer programs and printouts, social media communications, including, but not limited, to FaceTime, Instagram, FaceBook.com, text messages, and other records or voice records, films or tapes As well as any screenshots or other record showing calls of which there are no other records were made.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

title: Guerini Crime Family (Drug Enforcement Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Guerini Crime Family (Drug Enforcement Administration)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I seek access to records in your possession regarding the activities of the Guerini crime family, specifically relating to:

1. Their involvement in dock strikes and union activity during the post-World War II period.
2. Their participation in political violence in post-war France.
3. Their role in heroin trafficking, particularly connections between Europe and the United States during the mid-20th century.

Scope of Request:

Timeframe: 1945–1960.
Geographic Focus: Primarily France and Europe, with connections to the United States.
Focus Areas: Organized crime, labor union influence, political unrest, and narcotics trafficking.

Specific Records of Interest:

-Investigations, surveillance, or intelligence reports related to the Guerini crime family or their associates.
-Records detailing international collaboration or law enforcement efforts targeting organized crime and narcotics trafficking.
-Reports on labor unrest or political violence where organized crime may have played a role.

Purpose of Request:
This request is made for historical research purposes to understand the influence of organized crime on labor movements, political events, and international narcotics trafficking. The information sought is of public and scholarly interest and pertains to understanding transnational organized crime during the post-war era.

Additional Notes:

I am not requesting personal information or records that identify confidential informants, third parties, or victims. My request pertains solely to records documenting the activities of the Guerini family or broader patterns associated with their influence.
If any records contain sensitive material, I request that redacted versions be provided in accordance with FOIA requirements.  Please include any records that originated from predecessor agencies (e.g., the Federal Bureau of Narcotics, Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs, etc.).  If any portion of this request is denied, I request a detailed explanation of the exemption(s) applied and a Vaughn Index describing withheld records and justifications for non-disclosure.

File Categories to Search:
Please search any relevant investigative, intelligence, or archival files pertaining to:
1. Narcotics trafficking (e.g., heroin smuggling routes from France to the U.S.).
2. Labor movements and union activity (e.g., dock strikes influenced by organized crime).
3. Political violence or unrest in post-war France tied to organized crime.

Thank you for your assistance. Please feel free to contact me here if clarification or additional information is required to process this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edward Nestor

title: Guerini Crime Family (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Guerini Crime Family (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I seek access to records in your possession regarding the activities of the Guerini crime family, specifically relating to:

1. Their involvement in dock strikes and union activity during the post-World War II period.
2. Their participation in political violence in post-war France.
3. Their role in heroin trafficking, particularly connections between Europe and the United States during the mid-20th century.

Scope of Request:

Timeframe: 1945–1960.
Geographic Focus: Primarily France and Europe, with connections to the United States.
Focus Areas: Organized crime, labor union influence, political unrest, and narcotics trafficking.

Specific Records of Interest:

-Investigations, surveillance, or intelligence reports related to the Guerini crime family or their associates.
-Records detailing international collaboration or law enforcement efforts targeting organized crime and narcotics trafficking.
-Reports on labor unrest or political violence where organized crime may have played a role.

Purpose of Request:
This request is made for historical research purposes to understand the influence of organized crime on labor movements, political events, and international narcotics trafficking. The information sought is of public and scholarly interest and pertains to understanding transnational organized crime during the post-war era.

Additional Notes:

I am not requesting personal information or records that identify confidential informants, third parties, or victims. My request pertains solely to records documenting the activities of the Guerini family or broader patterns associated with their influence.
If any records contain sensitive material, I request that redacted versions be provided in accordance with FOIA requirements.  Please include any records that originated from predecessor agencies (e.g., the Federal Bureau of Narcotics, Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs, etc.).  If any portion of this request is denied, I request a detailed explanation of the exemption(s) applied and a Vaughn Index describing withheld records and justifications for non-disclosure.

File Categories to Search:
Please search any relevant investigative, intelligence, or archival files pertaining to:
1. Narcotics trafficking (e.g., heroin smuggling routes from France to the U.S.).
2. Labor movements and union activity (e.g., dock strikes influenced by organized crime).
3. Political violence or unrest in post-war France tied to organized crime.

Thank you for your assistance. Please feel free to contact me here if clarification or additional information is required to process this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edward Nestor

title: Public records request logs

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public records request logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Logs,  or reports maintained by the Mayor's Office that track public records requests submitted to the City of Boston.

Documentation of the frequency of denials or rejections of public records requests, including reasons for denials where applicable.

Any correspondence or internal reports summarizing compliance with the Massachusetts Public Records Law by the Mayor's Office, including metrics related to timeliness and response rates.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: NASA support for 2014 Pink Floyd music video "Marooned"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NASA support for 2014 Pink Floyd music video "Marooned"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to NASA's support for the Pink Floyd music video "Marooned," released in 2014 and directed by Aubrey Powell. NASA's support for the video is apparently confirmed by the inclusion of an entry for "Pink Floyd" in a list 2014 NASA-supported entertainment released to me by FOIA. I request any and all documents pertaining to NASA support for the Pink Floyd music video "Marooned." Such documents may include but should not be not limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of NASA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Marooned," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Marines support for TV series "This American Land"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Marines support for TV series "This American Land"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the US Marine Corps and the production of one or more episodes of the TV series "This American Land" (2011-present), hosted by Bruce Burckhardt. According to a document released to me by the Marines through FOIA (see attached), the Marines provided support to this production in 2022. I therefore request any and all documents pertaining to Marine Corps support for "This American Land," inclusive of all episodes supported. Such documents may include but should not be not limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the Marines and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "This American Land," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: FOI Records Request :: R000059-112724
communications.communication:
Dear Toni Thompson: 
 
 
This message is an acknowledgement that the Connecticut Office of Early Childhood received your Freedom of Information Act request on 11/27/2024. It was given the reference number R000059-112724 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
This letter does not constitute a denial of your request. Rather, in accordance with the Freedom of Information Act, we are in the process of researching and gathering documentation which may be responsive to it. Once the documents are gathered, we will then conduct a review to determine if statutory exemptions to disclosure may apply to some or all of the documents. Upon completion of that review, we will be able to provide you with any responsive, non-exempt documents. 
 
Please note the department reserves the right to charge any such other fees as may be appropriate pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the OEC FOI Records Center. 
Connecticut Office of Early Childhood

title: Earl Lawrence Durham

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Earl Lawrence Durham
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating, to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry of Earl Lawrence Durham (d. October 27, 2007), including files 100-HQ-248516 and 100-CG-12890. Previously released records indicate Durham was the subject of wiretapping and had at least one informant reporting on his activities. The following symbol sources were directed at Durham between 1954 and 1956: CG 5974-S, CG 5985-S, CG 6040-S* (https://archive.org/details/FBI-ELSUR-nsia/18-cv-01868%20pp%202770-3077%20-%20ELSUR%20Indices%20-%20Chicago%20Section%204/page/n299/mode/2up; https://archive.org/details/FBI-ELSUR-nsia/18-cv-01868%20pp%203298-2482%20-%20ELSUR%20Indices%20-%20Chicago%20Section%206/page/n93/mode/2up) Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/chicagosuntimes/name/earl-durham-obituary?id=29644078 (This is a reprint of an obituary that originally appeared in the Chicago Sun-Times); https://www.ilga.gov/legislation/fulltext.asp?GAID=10&SessionID=76&GA=95&DocTypeID=SR&DocNum=422&LegID=48589&SpecSess=&Session= (Illinois State Senate resolution commemorating Durham)

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
